question_details.title: Will Elon Musk be the world's richest person on December 31, 2025?
question_details.description:
This question is synced with an identical question on Metaculus. The original question opened on 2024-12-20 21:05:00 and can be found [here](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/30863). This question will resolve to the same value as the synced question. The original question's background info at this time is below. 

Bloomberg maintains its [Real-Time Billionaires list](https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/), which is a tracker that is updated every day, ranking the world's wealthiest individuals based on net worth. In recent years, the list [has been topped](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_World%27s_Billionaires) by Bernard Arnault & family, Jeff Bezos, and Bill Gates. As of December 20, 2024, Elon Musk is in first place on the list, with \$455 billion, as compared with Jeff Bezos in second place with \$242 billion, Mark Zuckerberg in third place with \$211 billion, and Larry Ellison in fourth place with \$190 billion.

Elon Musk's wealth comes first and primarily from his shares of [Tesla](https://www.tesla.com/). According to Tesla's [proxy statement for 2024](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1318605/000110465924048040/tm2326076d13_pre14a.htm), Musk beneficially owned 20.5% of Tesla's shares. With a [market cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/tesla/marketcap/) at the time of this question of  1.249 Trillion, his stake in Tesla is worth 256 billion.

Secondly, Elon Musk [reportedly owns](https://www.the-independent.com/news/world/americas/musk-net-worth-spacex-trump-b2660290.html) 42% of [SpaceX](https://www.spacex.com/), which was recently valued at \$210 billion. This stake is worth \$88 billion, at that valuation. Additional stakes owned by Musk are 54%of [xAI](https://x.ai/), a startup valued at 50 billion; [Neuralink](https://neuralink.com/), which was valued at \$5 billion; the [Boring Company](http://www.boringcompany.com/), valued at \$5.68 billion in 2022, and, X (formerly Twitter), which was [recently valued](https://www.axios.com/2024/12/01/elon-musk-x-fidelity-mark-up) at about \$12 billion.

***

This question belongs to Vox's Future Perfect Community page and 2025 forecasting tournament. [Learn more and compete for the \$2,500 prize pool](https://www.metaculus.com/c/future-perfect/).

`{"format":"metac_closes_in_period","info":{"post_id":30863,"question_id":30605}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if, according to the [Bloomberg Billionaires Index](https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/), Elon Musk is ranked #1 in net worth when the resolution source is accessed by Metaculus on December 31, 2025. If Musk is not ranked #1, then this question resolves as **No**.
question_details.fine_print:
* If both Elon Musk and another individual are ranked #1, this resolves as **No**.
* If the Billionaires Index is not available on December 31, 2025, this question will be resolved as the first day for which it is available. If it is not available before January 4, 2026, this question will be **annulled**.
* Bloomberg outlines its methodology [here](https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/methodology/).
* In the event of Bloomberg changing its methodology for calculating the net worths of the individuals on its list, Admins will make a determination about whether the change is substantial enough to annul the question, at their discretion.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**World's Richest Lose Nearly $70 Billion Amid Trump's Escalation of Tariffs Against China**
The world's richest men experienced significant financial losses on October 10, 2025, as Donald Trump's escalation of tariffs against China triggered market volatility. According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, the top 10 billionaires lost a combined US$ 68.8 billion. Elon Musk, the world's wealthiest individual, led the losses with a US$ 15.8 billion decline in his fortune. Jeff Bezos lost US$ 10.2 billion, Mark Zuckerberg (Meta) lost US$ 9.67 billion, and Jensen Huang (Nvidia) lost US$ 8 billion. The sell-off was driven by Trump's announcement of 100% tariffs on Chinese imports and export controls on critical U.S.-made software, effective November 1, 2025. U.S. tech stocks—Amazon (AMZN), Nvidia (NVDA), and Tesla (TSLA)—fell approximately 5%, collectively erasing US$ 770 billion in market value. The Nasdaq dropped 3.6% and the S&P 500 fell 2.7%, marking their worst day since April 2024. The market reaction was immediate, with further declines in tech stocks after the market closed.
Original language: pt
Publish date: October 10, 2025 09:46 PM
Source:[Exame](https://exame.com/invest/mercados/mais-ricos-do-mundo-perdem-quase-us-70-bilhoes-com-escalada-tarifaria-entre-trump-e-china/)

**The richest people of September 2025: Elon Musk rockets to $490bn, while Bezos takes a billion-dollar dive**
In September 2025, the world's top 10 billionaires collectively gained $201 billion, bringing their combined net worth to $2.3 trillion as of October 1, 2025, driven by record-high US stock markets. Elon Musk led the list for the 17th consecutive month, with his fortune rising by $75.2 billion to $490.8 billion, nearing the $500 billion milestone, fueled by a 33% surge in Tesla shares due to investor enthusiasm over his AI and robotics initiatives and a potential $1 trillion pay package. Larry Ellison climbed to second place with a $70.9 billion gain, reaching $341.8 billion, after Oracle stock rose 24% on strong cloud and AI projections—his net worth jumped nearly $100 billion in a single day on September 10, a record. Mark Zuckerberg remained third with $251.5 billion, despite a $1.5 billion dip tied to Meta's stock. Jeff Bezos dropped to fourth with $232.5 billion after losing $8.4 billion as Amazon shares fell 4%. Jensen Huang rose from No. 9 to No. 7, gaining $10.7 billion as Nvidia's valuation hit $4.5 trillion amid surging AI chip demand. Larry Page (No. 5, $202.2B) and Sergey Brin (No. 6, $187.6B) gained from Alphabet's rebound following a favorable antitrust ruling. Bernard Arnault fell to No. 8 with $159.4 billion despite a modest gain. Steve Ballmer dropped to No. 9, though he added $2.9 billion thanks to Microsoft share growth and his LA Clippers team. Warren Buffett, at No. 10, saw a $200 million decline, holding $150.2 billion. Only three billionaires in the top 10 saw slight declines.
Original language: en
Publish date: October 09, 2025 04:16 PM
Source:[The Financial Express](https://www.financialexpress.com/trending/the-richest-people-of-september-2025-elon-musk-rockets-to-490bn-while-bezos-takes-a-billion-dollar-dive/4005000/)

**Elon Musk: From the Richest Man on Earth to a Poverty Testimony of Our Modern Society**
Elon Musk, who is approaching a net worth of 500 billion dollars and is recognized by Forbes as the richest person on Earth—approximately 150 billion dollars ahead of Larry Ellison—has become a symbol of systemic contradictions in modern capitalism. While his entrepreneurial achievements with Tesla and SpaceX are acknowledged as transformative and the result of intense effort and strategic planning, the article criticizes Musk for his controversial political affiliations, including public admiration for Donald Trump and perceived alignment with right-wing populist movements like the AfD. The author argues that Musk’s immense wealth—enough to erase the debt of entire nations—exposes a broken economic system, especially as millions struggle with basic expenses like electricity bills. The piece contends that Musk’s rise is not a triumph of merit but a societal failure: a man with questionable character and conduct has amassed unprecedented power, and the public may ultimately bear the cost of his 'delusional visions.' The article concludes that Musk’s status as the world’s richest person is not a cause for celebration but an indictment of contemporary society. The commentary is published by news.de, with the author Mia Lada-Klein, and was released on October 7, 2025.
Original language: de
Publish date: October 07, 2025 05:13 PM
Source:[news.de](https://www.news.de/wirtschaft/859006700/elon-musk-ist-mit-500-milliarden-dollar-der-reichste-mensch-tech-milliardaer-liefert-ein-armutszeugnis-der-gesellschaft/1/)

**Elon Musk Net Worth Surges Past $500 Billion as Tesla and SpaceX Drive Historic Wealth**
Elon Musk became the first individual in history to surpass a net worth of $500 billion in October 2025, according to Forbes, driven by his stakes in Tesla, SpaceX, and xAI. His estimated wealth reached $500 billion before a slight dip due to market fluctuations, with Tesla’s valuation exceeding $1.5 trillion. Musk’s wealth is composed of approximately $180 billion from Tesla (~12% ownership), $160+ billion from SpaceX (~42% ownership), and $75+ billion from xAI (majority stake). A proposed $1 trillion stock-based pay package from Tesla’s board is conditional on future production and revenue targets, potentially making Musk the world’s first trillionaire. SpaceX, valued at around $400 billion, continues to grow through space exploration, satellite launches, and defense contracts. Despite volatility—Musk lost over $70 billion in early 2025 due to political controversies and Tesla’s stock downturn—his net worth rebounded after he disengaged from political disputes. His fortune reflects the risks and rewards of wealth tied to innovation in tech, space, and artificial intelligence. While Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison briefly challenged Musk’s ranking, Forbes currently lists Musk as the world’s richest person, underscoring the dynamic nature of modern wealth in technology-driven markets.

Publish date: October 03, 2025 01:47 AM
Source:[el-balad.com](https://www.el-balad.com/2020291)

**Top Billionaires List Sees Major Shift: Musk, Bezos, Zuckerberg Slip, Ambani-Adani’s Rise**
Following U.S. President Donald Trump's announcement of a 100% additional tariff on Chinese goods, the U.S. stock market experienced a sharp decline on Friday, October 11, 2025, impacting the net worth of the world’s top 25 billionaires. Of these, 23 saw a decrease in wealth. However, Indian billionaires Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani saw their net worth increase. Ambani’s net worth rose by $37.9 billion to $97.5 billion, making him the 18th richest person globally, while Adani’s net worth increased by $63 billion to $88.8 billion, placing him 20th. Ambani’s wealth grew by $6.85 billion and Adani’s by $10.1 billion year-to-date. The Indian stock market also performed strongly, with the BSE Sensex rising 328 points to close at a higher level. Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, saw the largest decline, with his net worth dropping from $452.8 billion to $437 billion, a loss of $15.8 billion, and his year-to-date gain reduced to just $4.36 billion.

**Peter Thiel Advises Elon Musk Against Joining Gates' Giving Pledge**
American billionaire Peter Thiel, a close associate of Donald Trump and a well-known venture capitalist, publicly advised Elon Musk not to join the Giving Pledge initiative, launched by Bill Gates. Thiel made this statement during a private lecture in San Francisco as part of the 'Antichrist' program, according to TASS. He argued that Musk, who is considered the wealthiest person in the world with a net worth of $485 billion, should not participate in the pledge, which requires donating a significant portion of one's wealth to charity during life or through a will. 'Your money will go to left-leaning non-profit organizations chosen by Gates,' Thiel told Musk directly. Musk joined the Giving Pledge in 2012, which has since attracted over 240 major entrepreneurs and business leaders from 29 countries, including Michael Bloomberg, George Lucas, David Rockefeller, and Mark Zuckerberg. Thiel’s warning comes amid reports of a sharp rise in leadership turnover at Musk’s companies, particularly among key AI and robotics specialists. Additionally, following the deterioration of relations between Donald Trump and Elon Musk last summer, leaders from Meta and OpenAI have reportedly sought ways to reestablish ties with the U.S. president.

As of September 30, 2025, Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla (TSLA.US), remained the world's richest person with a net worth of $459 billion, an increase of nearly $27 billion year-to-date. summary:
All expert forecasts converge on the assessment that Elon Musk is highly likely to remain the world's richest person according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index on December 31, 2025. They consistently note Musk's substantial current lead ($100–150B) over his closest rivals (Larry Ellison, Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos), and that this margin has proven resilient to market swings and volatility throughout 2025, despite brief interruptions like Ellison's September surge. 

Key factors increasing the probability of Musk's retention of the top spot include the magnitude of his current lead, diversified holdings (Tesla, SpaceX, xAI), and the insulation provided by private company valuations, which are less susceptible to daily market fluctuations. Several experts emphasize the base rate, historical stickiness of billionaire rankings, and Musk's capacity to quickly rebound after asset value declines. Additionally, Musk's eligibility for large performance-based compensation and recent confidence signals (e.g., Tesla share purchases) further bolster his position.

Decreasing factors revolve around the volatility of tech stocks, especially Tesla, and the possibility of a rare but dramatic surge in a competitor's assets (as happened briefly with Ellison). Other notable risks include potential regulatory, legal, or macroeconomic shocks, though experts see no clear signs of such events imminent. The scenario for a 'No' outcome generally requires both a Musk-specific disaster (e.g., a Tesla crash, regulatory scandal) and/or an extraordinary positive event for a competitor, scenarios considered possible but low probability within the short 2.5 month window before resolution.

Final forecast probabilities cluster in the 80–92% range, with most experts assigning a high probability (85–88%) that Musk will remain #1 at year-end, confidently citing the scale of his lead, status quo bias, and lack of credible near-term competitive threats. The consensus is that, absent an extraordinary shock or a competitor's historic rally, Musk will maintain his title through December 2025.
